channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Black Lives Matter protesters prepare to march on UK cities for fourth straight weekend
item.description: Police officers wearing face masks moved in on a group making their way to George Square, Glasgow as BLM protestors prepare to march on UK cities for the fourth consecutive weekend.

item.title: Man, 27, and woman, 22, are arrested after three people are stabbed in Liverpool knife attack
item.description: One of the men suffered a serious stab wound to his stomach in the Kensington area of the city. The two others, a man and a woman, suffered head injuries.

item.title: Two teenagers aged 16 and 17 jailed for total of 25 years for killing friend outside shopping center
item.description: Michael Irving (pictured) was lured into a 'Trojan Horse' trap on the evening of September 3 last year in West Ham, east London, by two teenage boys he considered to be his friends.
item.media:description: Michael Irving was found with fatal stab wounds (Metropolitan Police/PA)

item.title: Black cake company boss reveals he asked his white wife to front his business after facing racism
item.description: Junior Thompson (pictured) only recently announced he was the man behind Khalids Kakes in Birmingham after being inspired by the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: Britain announces 129 more Covid-19 deaths
item.description: Today's figure is the lowest Saturday jump since March 21, two days before lockdown, when just 56 fatalities were recorded.

item.title: Britons are set to enjoy takeaway booze amid 73F sunshine today
item.description: Most areas of the country felt much warmer than Friday today with temperatures reaching 23C in London and Brighton this afternoon.

item.title: Pubs are given the green-light for drinking al fresco in the streets
item.description: Revellers enjoyed takeaway pints outside bars in London while basking in glorious sunshine and enjoying temperatures of 73F.

item.title: 'I'm sick of t-shirts, I want action': Dion Dublin demands more government measures to educate kids
item.description: Dion Dublin slammed the Government on a live showing of Football Focus for not tackling the problem of racism in the UK and has called on them to take proper action.

item.title: PM drops anti-chlorinated chicken Tory MP from intelligence committee
item.description: Former environment secretary Theresa Villiers, pictured, has been dropped from the House of Commons Intelligence and Security Committee by Boris Johnson for a lack of loyalty.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn's brother Piers, 73, is charged with breaching coronavirus lockdown rules
item.description: Piers Corbyn, 73, has been charged with taking part in demonstrations on May 16 and May 24 in Hyde Park in central London. He is due to appear at Westminster Magistrates' Court.

item.title: 'Air bridges' plan is set to involve fewer than 10 countries including Spain, Greece and France
item.description: A total of 12 countries - including Greece, Spain, Portugal and France - are being considered with officials examining both the coronavirus risk and the destination's popularity.

item.title: Four men are arrested over murder plot after customer, 21, was shot in the leg at McDonald's
item.description: A 23-year-old from Oxton, a 20-year-old and a 19-year-old from Tranmere and a 33-year-old from Liverpool were all arrested on suspicion of conspiracy to murder today.

item.title: Lady Louise and Prince Edward enjoy a canter around Windsor's grounds
item.description: Riding a white-dappled steed, Lady Louise, 16 looked delighted to be back in the saddle again, pictured for the first time since lockdown began riding with Prince Edward in the grounds of Windsor.

item.title: Sophie Wessex delivers a speech at a virtual UN event for Elimination of Sexual Violence in Conflict
item.description: Making an impassioned speech, the royal, 55, said that survivors were key to helping eliminate sexual violence and that there is likely to have been a 'substantial' rise in cases since lockdown began.

item.title: The 'R' on a knife-edge: Rate of infection hovers close to 1 in the North West, Midlands and London
item.description: Carl Heneghan, professor of evidence-based medicine at Oxford University, said the fewer infected patients there are in the UK, the greater the margin for error when estimating the R value.

item.title: Portuguese prosecutors DESTROYED vital DNA evidence
item.description: Irish rape victim Hazel Behan waived her right to anonymity last week to say she believed a masked man who targeted her in her Algarve apartment could have been the German sex offender.

item.title: Parents slam school after 13-year-old children were told to plan their own FUNERAL as homework
item.description: Religious studies homework, given out by St Paul's Catholic School in Leicester, asked Year Eight students to pick out their favourite music for their funeral and choose their coffin.

item.title: Former Archbishop of Canterbury among faith leaders calling for lone migrant children protection
item.description: Former Archbishop of Canterbury Dr Rowan Williams is among 250 faith leaders calling on Boris Johnson to guarantee the rights of lone migrant children to seek refuge here.

item.title: Kyle Walker proposes to ex after they split when he cheated
item.description: The England footballer, 30, reportedly surprised the model, 27, with an epic floral proposal at her home after she admitted she's open to rekindling their romance.

item.title: More than 1,000 people died every day in the UK for 22 consecutive days
item.description: The latest figures, which reflect deaths in hospitals, care homes and private homes, dwarf those that were announced by ministers at the time, which only took hospital fatalities into account.

item.title: Mortgage holidays taken by one in six homeowners during lockdown
item.description: An average of £755 has been deferred by 1.9million borrowers each month since March, up from 1.8million last month. Banks have been required to offer payment breaks since the lockdown began.

item.title: Parliament's artworks are being 're-evaluated' because many have a 'racist history', says curator
item.description: Melissa Hamnett, the head of heritage collections and curator of works of art, said officials are evaluating Westminster's art collection in light of the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: China lays claim to entire Galwan Valley where Chinese and Indian troops fought deadly brawl
item.description: The midnight brawl in part of the disputed Ladakh region along the Himalayan frontier was the deadliest in 45 years as 63 soldiers are thought to have been killed.

item.title: Couple spend £900 on building their own gym
item.description: Jodie Leah Foulger, 34, and Andy Fernandez, 32, who live in Southend-on-Sea, Essex, impressed members of Facebook's DIY On A Budget UK, with photos of their home gym.

item.title: Staffordshire Bull Terrier is treated under anaesthetic
item.description: Louisa Davis, 45, from Nottingham, said she overheard scuffling in the kitchen before seeing her Staffie Bonnie, ten, emerge from the recycling bin with the tuna can stuck to her face.

item.title: Security guards patrol Stonehenge to keep revellers away as druids prepare to watch virtual sunrise
item.description: The Salisbury Plain monument in Wiltshire is a firm favourite for watching the sunrise and sunset during the longest day of the year, but celebrations have been abandoned for the first time.

item.title: Home cooks are being coached on Zoom to make delicious dinners by top chefs
item.description: After the raw ingredients arrive, diners are sent a link to a Zoom meeting where a chef guides them through how to prep a dish as they would at their restaurant.

item.title: Elon Musk tells Johnny Depp and Amber Heard to 'bury the hatchet and move on' as he denies threesome
item.description: Elon Musk has denied having a threesome affair with Amber Heard and Cara Delevingne. 'Cara and I are friends, but we've never been intimate. She would confirm this,' the Tesla CEO, 48, said.

item.title: Boris Johnson is set to kick-start UK economy as he looks to rebrand his premiership after lockdown
item.description: The PM will announce the relaxation of the two-metre rule and the reopening of the UK hospitality sector next week - both to come into force in early July - amid low public trust in the Government.

item.title: Woman argues 8am isn't too early to cut the grass
item.description: Writing anonymously on UK online forum Mumsnet , the woman asked if it would be acceptable to take out the lawnmower at 8am because she is too tired to do it after work.

item.title: Two men are arrested for 'attempted abduction' after a 13-year-old was grabbed
item.description: Police arrested a 21-year-old man from St Albans and a 20-year-old man from Welwyn Garden City (pictured) on suspicion of attempted abduction yesterday.

item.title: UK's first drive-in music concert sees three bands perform to sell-out crowd of 80 cars
item.description: Between 200 and 300 concert goers took social-distancing measures at the UK's first drive-in concert during lockdown in Royal Victoria Country Park in Netley near Southampton, Hampshire.

item.title: Pet owners shared snaps of the things their pups did when they thought no one was looking
item.description: From the US to Romania, dog lovers have shared hilarious snaps of what their four-legged friends did when they thought their owners were not looking. The pictures were shared on Bored Panda.

item.title: US attorney who investigated Trump allies REFUSES to quit
item.description: Geoffrey Berman said in a strongly worded statement that he will not be leaving his position as U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, despite Barr's claim late Friday.

item.title: Ex-policeman thug who was carried to safety by a BLM protester used to work undercover as a hooligan
item.description: The photograph of the heroic figure emerging from the baying mob in central London last weekend with an injured man slung over his shoulder was certainly an unforgettable image.

item.title: The avowed aims of the British arm of Black Lives Matter
item.description: Who are Black Lives Matter? Where did they come from and what, exactly, do they believe in? These may seem silly questions.

item.title: Brazil becomes second country to hit one million coronavirus cases after the US
item.description: Brazil recorded more than 1,200 deaths for the fourth consecutive day bringing the total to nearly 49,000 yesterday. It comes two months after the US reached the one million mark.

item.title: Britons splash out on swimming pools as they try to recreate luxury holidays at home amid lockdown
item.description: Britain's super rich have spent the money they have saved on holidays on luxury home improvement. Private swimming pools costing £90,000 have seen a rise in enquiries of 300 per cent.

item.title: Motorway petrol stations charge an extra 34p per litre as drivers embark on long car journeys
item.description: Motorway petrol stations are ripping off motorists by up to 34p per litre on fuel. It can cost £18.70 more to fill up a family car on the motorway than at supermarket forecourts nearby.

item.title: Katie Hopkins is BANNED from Twitter for breaking rules on hate speech
item.description: The former Apprentice star turned right wing commentator sparked outrage on numerous occasions in recent years with comments on race, religion and immigration.

item.title: Raoul Moat's daughter breaks her silence 10 years after her father's killing spree
item.description: Katelaine Fitzpatrick, now 21, has spoken out for the first time on the man who left her with feelings of disgust and shame, despite being just 11-years-old when he went on a twisted killing spree.

item.title: Lifelong devotee reveals why the bob is the perfect corona cut when hairdressers finally reopen
item.description: Lucy Worsley always wanted long, curly hair, because the little girl who lived next door told her that angels had hair like that.

item.title: Women are less likely to swipe for a man pictured with a cat
item.description: Posing with a pet might seem like the way to a women's heart but new research, carried out by Colorado State University, showed that men posing with feline pets were less likely to get a date

item.title: Ansel Elgort accused of sexually assault of girl, 17, in 2014
item.description: A young woman named Gabby has claimed that she began messaging actor Ansel Elgort, 26, shortly before her 17th birthday on Snapchat

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Child, 12, dies at Sheffield Children's Hospital
item.description: A 12-year-old child has died at Sheffield Children's Hospital after contracting coronavirus, NHS England have said. The exact cause of death has not been established.

item.title: Is the glass half-full… or half-empty? The answer could affect your risk of getting dementia
item.description: While severe depression can ruin lives, there are many people who, while not clinically depressed, endure an existence blighted by negative thinking.

item.title: Trump slams D.C. police for 'doing nothing' as protesters topple Confederate monument
item.description: President Donald Trump hit out at Washington D.C. police late on Friday night, claiming they were 'doing nothing' as protesters tore down and burned a statue of a Confederate general.

item.title: How much are house prices forecast to rise near you over five years?
item.description: Property sales will slump more than previously expected and remain subdued into next year, estate agent Savills has warned, as it issued new house price forecasts

item.title: Man hired to moderate Facebook content says more MUST be done to block harrowing uploads
item.description: CHRIS GRAY: To be honest, I don't remember the first time I watched an execution. When you've seen so many that they start to blur into one, it's impossible to remember the first.

item.title: Macy's employee beaten for allegedly using the n-word but company says it was 'unprovoked'
item.description: Macy's claimed in a statement Friday that an attack on a white employee was 'unprovoked' despite claims he used a racial slur to speak about a black shopper.

item.title: Lyft passenger threatens to crush driver's skull after he asks him to wear a mask
item.description: A man in Reno, Nevada, who gave his name as Richard has been banned from Lyft's app after racially-abusing a Hispanic driver who asked him to wear a face mask inside his car.

item.title: Trump says Americans killed by coronavirus will not have 'died in vain' as the economy is rebounding
item.description: Donald Trump posted a video on Twitter on Friday night in which he said that Americans who lost their lives to COVID-19 will not have 'died in vain' because the economy is bouncing back.

item.title: Obama's national security adviser Susan Rice blasts Trump administration as 'racist to the core'
item.description: Susan Rice (left) said she wants to 'remove Trump (top right) and consign those who supported him in the Senate (like Mitch McConnell, bottom right) to the trash heap of history.'

item.title: China slams accusations they were behind cyber-attack on the Australian government and businesses
item.description: Australian Strategic Policy Institute executive director Peter Jennings said the attack was '95 per cent or more' likely to have been launched from China.

item.title: How will schools in England reopen? The government refuses to reveal how secondaries will work
item.description: Schools in England currently have no guidance on how they will teach full classes from September. Guidance from Northern Ireland has suggested slashing two metre distancing in half.
item.media:credit: Jacques Feeney | MI News & Sport Ltd

item.title: Tories suspend activist who tweeted Labour shadow minister Naz Shah 'should go back to Pakistan'
item.description: The Tories, which have launched an independent inquiry into all forms of prejudice within the party, said Theodora Dickinson had been suspended.

item.title: Baby boy born in lockdown at 23 weeks weighing just over 1lb is set to go home
item.description: Tiny Oliver-Cash Lowther-Ryan, born just seven inches long, has been dubbed 'Rocky' after surviving two operations, and will soon be ready to leave hospital with his parents.

item.title: Mariella Frostrup says male TV bosses underestimated her
item.description: The journalist, 57, said male executives would assume she would not attract female audiences due to her looks.

item.title: The year of the great British staycation: Here's how UK regions are shaping up and what to expect
item.description: July 4 has been bandied about as the date when staycations will finally snap into action in the UK. Here is the latest from around the country, as tourist boards and hotels proceed on that basis.

item.title: How to turn a Father's Day barbie into a cutting-edge cook-out
item.description: From a barbecue you control with your phone, to a robot that cleans the grill, TANITH CAREY tries gadgets for dads who want to be true barbecue kings...

item.title: Business partner of private detective, found dead in 1987, is seen strolling with victim's lover...
item.description: On March 10, 1987, estate agent Margaret Harrison had a very busy social diary. First, she attended a lunch party near her office in the company of a burly private investigator called Jonathan Rees.

item.title: Are we going on a summer holiday? We reveal where we can go and where we can't from Spain to Cyprus
item.description: Should you cancel your villa booking for July or August? Will you be welcome wherever it is you had planned to go? Here we help readers find a way through the quagmire.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Harry and Meghan ditch the Queen's lawyers
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: I can reveal that Prince Harry and Meghan have, dropped a huge hint that they will not be rejoining the Firm by ditching the Queen's lawyers, Harbottle & Lewis.

item.title: Man appears in court charged with the murder of Irish police detective Colm Horkan
item.description: Stephen Sliver, from Aughaward, Foxford in Co Mayo, appeared before a special sitting at Castlerea District Court, charged with the murder of Detective Garda Colm Horkan.

item.title: PLATELL'S PEOPLE: Lockdown ladies have our guilty pleasures...
item.description: PLATELL'S PEOPLE: Variety magazine described it as a 'thoroughly terrible, politically objectionable, occasionally hilarious Polish humpathon'.

item.title: Twitter and Facebook REMOVE Trump's 'racist baby' tweet due to copyright complaint
item.description: Jukin Media, the online company that entered into a licensing agreement with the parent who filmed the original encounter, says it filed a copyright claim after President Trump posted the video on Thursday.

item.title: Pictured: Boy, six, who was found with fatal head injuries
item.description: West Midlands Police, who were called to a property in Solihull, west Midlands, at around 3pm on Tuesday, rushed Arthur Hughes to Birmingham Children's Hospital but he died on Wednesday.

item.title: Scientists are 'totally comfortable' for Boris Johnson to reduce the 2metre rule to 1metre
item.description: The two-metre rule is finally set to be relaxed following a significant lowering of the virus alert level. Government source revealed scientific advisers were now 'comfortable' with reducing restriction.

item.title: Great British Bake Off bosses 'ban older contestants on this year's show due to coronavirus'
item.description: The Channel 4 show has a proud tradition of inviting a diverse age range of contestants, with many aged over 60.

item.title: Slaves' guitarist Laurie Vincent reveals his girlfriend has died aged 32 after cancer battle
item.description: The musician, 26, took to Instagram on Wednesday to pen an emotional tribute to his other half following her tragic death, as he gushed that she 'showed me what love means.'

item.title: Trump's Tulsa rally to go ahead after Supreme Court decision
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign rally in Tulsa is good to go after Oklahoma Supreme Court struck down a legal challenge trying to stop it and the mayor rescinded his curfew order.

item.title: Financier Amanda Staveley is accused of operating a 'hustle' to take £1billion off Barclays
item.description: Amanda Staveley, who once dated Prince Andrew, claims Barclays owes her up to £1.5billion after edging her out of a major deal in 2008.

item.title: Plastic surgeons reveal what procedures Bella and Gigi Hadid may have undergone
item.description: TikTok user Lila Savoia attended Malibu High School with Gigi and Bella, and their brother Anwar, and she recently shared their yearbook photos - which plastic surgeons have examined.

item.title: 'Mild' form of IVF could save NHS millions, says fertility doctor
item.description: A medical review found women who have the 'kinder' treatment, known as mild IVF, are just as likely to get pregnant as those undergoing conventional IVF.

item.title: A new film centres on Christmas at Sandringham in 1992... but Diana wasn't there that weekend
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Now Hollywood star Kristen Stewart, who made her name in the hit vampire romance film, Twilight, is preparing for her close-up in the role.

item.title: JENNI MURRAY reveals her battle with the bulge that so many women will recognise
item.description: JENNI MURRAY: Perhaps there's a moment for everyone who sets out on the road to obesity when things begin to get out of control. And that moment is often triggered by some big change in one's life.

item.title: Andrew Marr reveals his father has died
item.description: Andrew Marr has tonight revealed that Nick Robinson will host his politics show this Sunday following the death of his father.

item.title: JOHN HUMPHRYS: We all need true heroes and villains… but which one is Boris Johnson?
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: Magistrates' courts in small towns are where journalists' careers were forged back in the heyday of the local paper.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Murder suspect admitted he was a predator
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The German suspect told an investigating judge he was sex offender when he was interrogated for stealing diesel from commercial trucks in the Algarve in 2006.

item.title: Juneteenth: Millions in US celebrate with anti-racism marches
item.description: Millions of Americans joined together on Juneteenth to celebrate the abolition of slavery with anti-racism marches and peaceful demonstrations across the United States

item.title: George Clooney jibes Donald Trump over claim he 'made Juneteenth famous'
item.description: George Clooney has sarcastically jibed President Donald Trump over his claim that he 'made Juneteenth famous' by donating $500K to a charity that fights against racial inequality.

item.title: How football's restart was tainted by TWENTY FOUR ads for cynical gambling giants
item.description: Gambling giants were last night accused of 'providing the gateway for the next generation of harm' after bombarding sports fans with TV adverts and free bets during the return of Premier League football.

item.title: Mail Force campaign raises £10million just weeks after asking for donations to protect NHS heroes
item.description: More than 7.5million items have already been sent to care homes and hospitals - to be supplemented next week with Mail Force's biggest airlift yet.

item.title: Slow-motion footage captures an Apple Watch Series 5 'coughing' out droplets of water
item.description: YouTubers, known as The Slow Mo Guys, used a micro lens to get a close look at the Apple Watch Series 5 speaker to see how it 'coughs' out droplets after the device is submerged in water.

item.title: Speed limits through motorway roadworks could rise from 50mph to 60mph
item.description: Highways England has carried out a 12-month trial to look at raising the roadworks limit to 60mph under certain conditions. The findings could lead to the 50mph limit being scrapped in some areas.

item.title: George Washington statue toppled by Portland protesters
item.description: The George Washington statue, which stood on the lawn of the German American Society in Northeast Portland, was pulled down by protesters on Thursday night.

item.title: Loneliness alters neural 'maps' of the brain, study shows
item.description: Neural activity in our brain can show whether we are experiencing loneliness. Sociable people show similar 'stamps' of brain activity when they think about themselves and their friends.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: Should I kick out this lazy, moaning sponger?
item.description: This week Bel advises a woman about whether she should stay in a relationship with a man who refuses to pay towards anything and checks up on her all the time.

item.title: Marcus Rashford takes the knee and raises fist for BLM
item.description: Marcus Rashford was among the football stars to lead the show of solidarity for the Black Lives Matter movement on Friday night, as Manchester United faced Tottenham in the return of Premier League.

item.title: X-ray telescope's map of universe shows 1M cosmic objects
item.description: The eROSITA X-ray Telescope completed its first full sweep of the hot, energetic universe over 182 days, resulting in a stunning map that highlights more than one million cosmic objects.
item.media:credit: Max Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics

item.title: Meghan Markle feels 'destined' to help fight US systemic racism
item.description: Meghan Markle feels that her 'gnawing urgency to uproot from England' was fate so that she could be at the 'forefront' of the fight against systemic racism, the insider explained.

item.title: How a heavily pregnant woman and her boyfriend fought for their lives in a Cornish cove
item.description: Vicky Murphy tells of the bravery of RNLI lifeguards who came to rescue her and her boyfriend from a rip current at Chapel Porth in Cornwall. Vicky, who was heavily pregnant, and Marc had accepted death.

item.title: Mother-of-two BBC presenter Kate Silverton warns we must avoid 'mental health timebomb'
item.description: Kate Silverton told the Daily Mail that she believes children and parents have suffered 'chronic stress' as a result of lockdown.

item.title: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: Oriel college scholars who died to defeat Hitler would be appalled by today's mob
item.description: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: Many of them were barely out of their teens. But when their country called, they were not found wanting.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on… the replacement for the Cecil Rhodes statue
item.description: 'The college have played it too safe with their replacement for the Cecil Rhodes statue'

item.title: What travel tribe do YOU belong to? Some of us are cautious, some daring - and some plain defiant
item.description: This year, your summer holiday says more about you than cash ever can. So, are you a staycation sissy or an adventure addict ready to brave airport hell?

item.title: Norfolk woman stabbed to death outside former mental hospital
item.description: The victim is thought to have been attacked on wasteland next to the derelict remains of St Andrew's Hospital in Thorpe St Andrew near Norwich, Norfolk on Friday afternoon.

item.title: The Ritz Paris hotel auctions 1,500 lots after 110m revamp
item.description: The Paris Ritz on Place Vendome was a favourite of such icons as actress Audrey Hepburn and Ernest Hemingway. Now, you could own a piece of it as more than 1,500 lots are auctioned off.

item.title: Coronavirus: High levels of stress hormone cortisol raise risk
item.description: A study by Imperial College London researchers revealed that patients with high levels of the hormone deteriorated more quickly and were at a greater risk of dying.

item.title: WhatsApp glitch changes means nobody can see who is active
item.description: People claim their app´s `last seen´ feature is stuck on hidden and can't be changed. One user tweeted: 'Wouldn't even have noticed it if my mom wouldn't have bugged me for an hour about this.'

item.title: Angelina Jolie says she split from Brad Pitt for kids' 'well-being'
item.description: The 45-year-old Maleficent actresses made a rare reference to the former power couple's split in an interview with Vogue on Friday.

item.title: New book reveals 'racist' and 'sexist' VIP global party circuit
item.description: Ashley Mears, a former model who is now a sociology professor at Boston University, exposes the ultra-rich lifestyle in her new book 'Very Important People'.

item.title: Police search as man shot in leg at McDonald's Wirral drive-thru
item.description: The 21-year-old man was in the front passenger seat of a black Ford Tourneo in the McDonald's drive-thru at The Croft Retail & Leisure Park in Bromborough, Wirral.

item.title: Revellers breaking lockdown to attend illegal raves this weekend face prosecution
item.description: David Jamieson, West Midlands police and crime commissioner, said young people risked their families' wellbeing by breaching social distancing rules.

item.title: Bellway threatens to sue couple for banner on new build home
item.description: Jake Wright and his wife Chloe moved from Ibstock to Ashby-de-la-Zouch in Leicestershire after buying what they thought was their dream house in December 2018.

item.title: Children as young as EIGHT can show signs of susceptibility to type 2 diabetes
item.description: Experts from Bristol studied 4,000 participants in a long-running health study, using blood tests to hunt for the point at which signs of diabetes vulnerability first appears.

item.title: Dramatic footage shows huge chunk of glacier dropping into the sea and triggering a wave in Alaska
item.description: The moment was captured from a day cruise boat out of Seward, Alaska. The chunk fell from the Aialik Glacier which is the largest glacier in Aialik Bay.

item.title: Woman, 35, with IBS calls for end to stigma around the condition as she reveals life-limiting impact
item.description: Lucy, 35, from the Midlands, has battled the condition for over 10 years and told FEMAIL it's intensified by her stressful job as a chef. She didn't talk about it for years due to embarrassment.

item.title: The SAGE files: Shutting UK's borders would have 'little value' in stopping Covid-19 crisis
item.description: One of the scientific reports presented to UK ministers in May to help guide them through the crisis said restricting air travel would have virtually no effect because the damage was already done.

item.title: James Gandolfini's widow seen on 7th anniversary of his death
item.description: James Gandolfini's widow Deborah Lin was seen running errands last Friday with a mystery man and her daughter with the late actor Liliana, who is now seven years old.

item.title: Coronavirus 'can survive 20 YEARS in minus 20C temperatures'
item.description: Professor Li Lanjuan, a member of China's COVID-19 expert team, said that the virus could easily be transported between countries due to its exceptional abilities to endure cold conditions.
item.media:credit: Visual China Group via Getty Image

item.title: Boris blasts Sweet Chariot ban because 'nobody seems to know the words'
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson insisted rugby anthem Swing Low Sweet Chariot should be continued to be sung - because no-one knew the words beyond the famous first few lines

item.title: Chinese government leaks images of VW's all-electric ID.4
item.description: Leaked pictures were posted online after they were issued to China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology - a process that all car firms must follow to gain type approval in China.

item.title: Lower back pain may be eased by new nerve inhibitor drug
item.description: The drug, called tanezumab, inhibits nerve activity and has been found to provide relief in patients with chronic lower back pain - a leading cause of disability.

item.title: CERN backs new 62 mile £19 BILLION particle accelerator
item.description: The Future Circle Collider will have a 62 mile tunnel under France and Switzerland and be six times more powerful than the Large Hadron Collider.

item.title: Photos show elderly working class in 1960s, '70s and '80s
item.description: The images were taken by Shirley Baker - one of the leading British photographers of the post-war period - around Manchester and Salford.

item.title: Woman, 37, died after fight in Kettering residential street
item.description: Hayley Louise Adams (pictured), 37, died after police were called to an altercation in Kettering, Northamptonshire, on Monday. A man was arrested on suspicion of murder but later released.

item.title: Man survives accidentally firing nail through chin into BRAIN
item.description: The worker was trying to fix his nail gun, which had stopped working, when he unwittingly fired the 1.6-inch nail in Foshan, China. It remains unclear whether or not he was looking down the barrel of the gun.

item.title: Black men are THREE TIMES more likely to die of Covid-19 than white men, ONS
item.description: Figures showed 198.9 coronavirus deaths were recorded among every 100,000 Muslim men between the start of March and mid-May, compared to a rate of 80.7 for non-believers.

item.title: Gang of Romanian 'crime tourists' are jailed after flying to UK to raid 30 homes
item.description: Ninel Spiru, 26, his cousin Avram Spiru, 38, and Nicolae-Bogdan Baiceanu, 23, smashed into properties across the West Midlands between November 15 last year and February 3.

item.title: The 10 questions EVERY woman wants to ask a breast surgeon
item.description: Lucy Khan, a consultant cosmetic and oncoplastic breast surgeon, based in Edinburgh, has answered the top ten most commonly asked questions in her clinic for FEMAIL.

item.title: Nobel Peace Price winner Malala, 22, graduates from Oxford
item.description: The 22-year-old Nobel laureate shared two pictures of herself in Oxford covered in confetti and foam and said she planned to unwind from her studies with 'Netflix, reading and sleep'.

item.title: Queen praises 'heartwarming' response of Britain's companies
item.description: Her Majesty said it gave her 'great pride' to see what business groups are doing to 'help firms, champion trade and rebuild communities' amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Indian man lets 60,000 bees cover his FACE and says the insects are 'like his best friends'
item.description: The 24-year-old, known as Nature M.S., has been keeping bees on his face since he was seven years old, impressing his childhood friends with the trick in Kerala.

item.title: Grade II listed property goes on the market for £2.25m
item.description: The unusual Grade II listed home in Sheering, Essex, was built in 1760 but almost doubled in size when a Tudor Gothic style wing was added in 1824.

item.title: Routine tests for ALL office workers to combat coronavirus
item.description: Cambridge researchers said it was 'essential' that the strict testing measures were implemented in the UK to get the economy back up and running without the UK facing a second wave.

item.title: Red Arrows fly over Eiffel Tower in incredible pilot's-eye footage
item.description: Cockpit video from yesterday's display shows RAF jets in total streaking red, white and blue smoke over the French capital's landmarks, including the Eiffel Tower.

item.title: Man, 35, who threatened to stab Princess Anne, avoids jail
item.description: James Ballinger, 35, from Stroud, Gloucestershire was handed a 12-month community order after he threatened to stab Princess Anne claiming she was controlling his mind.
